item.content:encoded:
My Real Joy

My real joy is how my relationship with God has blossomed over the last few years. Ever since I started to make a more concerted effort to know God, He has responded to my persistent efforts.

I did not know it was truly possible to feel God’s presence in my daily life beyond just intillectual knowledge, but to truly feel God is around me at all fimes.

From the start it is evident that God has been slowly guiding my growth and formation. It seems clear that God is not demanding I become perfect all at onee, but we work together to affect my continval growth and formation. I only have to be persistent and work the next task. He is asking me to pay attention to. It all seems to stew, at least from my and of the relationship, my willingness to go to God persistently several times a day in various ways: formal & informal prayer, reading, contemplating, and, now, via writing.
